nl.naturalis.oaipmh.api

Interface IOAIRepository


  • public interface IOAIRepository

    Life-cycle interface defining the capacities of an OAI repository. This is the only interface that OAI repositories must implement, although they can optionally implement a few other interfaces (e.g. IResumptionTokenParser). OAI repositories do not provide the full OAI-PMH XML response. The REST layer sets up an XML skeleton and embeds the response from methods like listRecords() and getErrors() within the skeleton.

    Life Cycle

    For each OAI-PMH request the REST layer cycles through the following calls against the repository:

    1. Call getResumptionTokenParser() to parse the value of the resumptionToken query parameter (if present).
    2. Call the init method, passing it an OAIPMHRequest object.
    3. Call one of the six protocol request implementations (depending on the value of the verb argument).
    4. Call getErrors() to generate the <error> elements.
    5. Call done() to signify that a response has been sent back to client and that the request cycle is complete.

    Besides implementing the interface methods, OAI repository implementations must have a no-arg constructor.

    Author:
    Ayco Holleman

      • getResumptionTokenParser

        IResumptionTokenParser getResumptionTokenParser()
        Provide a resumption token reader. Used to decompose a resumption token into its constituent parts. Implementations may return null, in which case the default parser is used.
        Returns:

      • getErrors

        List<OAIPMHerrorType> getErrors()
        Return OAI-PMH specific errors. Implementations may return null or an empty list to indicate that there were no errors. Returning a non-empty list while also return a non-null response for the applicable protocol request is also allowed.
        Returns:

      • done

        void done()
        Called just after a response has been sent back to the client. Allows repository implentations the close resources created for the request, if necessary.
